sense.name: employees who assist a supervisor
sense.examples: Bob wants more staff reporting to him. The hospital staff have been working double shifts for two weeks. The military officers and their staff use this building as their temporary headquarters.

sense.name: faculty, as of a university or research laboratory
sense.examples: John is on the staff at Boston College. They are both research staff at a pharmaceutical lab. The university staff signed a petition endorsing the actions of the new Chancellor.

sense.name: a stout or solid stick, as for walking
sense.examples: Hickory or oak will make a good walking staff. The shepherd beat away the jackals with his staff. Here is a picture of my grandfather in evening clothes, leaning on a staff.

sense.name: a tool, a rod, used for surveying
sense.examples: The surveyors set up a staff in a flat spot of the meadow. A staff is used to measure distances and heights in the surveying of land.

sense.name: musical notation, a series of lines and spaces where notes are written
sense.examples: You play the notes on the treble staff and I'll play the ones on the bass staff. Each staff has five lines.

sense.name: building material, made of plaster
sense.examples: These temporary shelters are covered with staff. The exterior walls of the building were made of staff.

sense.name: a rod used as a symbol of authority or office
sense.examples: The bishop entered the hall, wearing his robes and carrying his staff. Statues of the ancient pharaohs indicated their royal stature via false beards and staffs held in the hand.

sense.name: bread, usually leavened and baked
sense.examples: Bread has been called the staff of life.
